update.description:
* removed http-server

* renamed ws_server to server

The http-server is causing me and probably you too some problems with the unneeded caching, and I couldn't really find a need to use two servers, is there?

This PR removes the `http-server` and uses the current `http` server in `gzbridge` to serve the application.

Running instructions: 
    1- `npm run start` this command is still the same, with the `port` as option.

    2- Navigate to `localhost:8080/index.html`
update.title: Use a single server

content.raw: Addressed the index.html issue on pull request #145. I didn't notice the longer startup time, but just in case, I added timestamps to a few messages so we can keep track of it.
content.html: Addressed the index.html issue on pull request #145. I didn't notice the longer startup time, but just in case, I added timestamps to a few messages so we can keep track of it.

update.description:
* removed http-server

* renamed ws_server to server

The http-server is causing me and probably you too some problems with the unneeded caching, and there is really no need to use two servers when we can just use one.

This PR removes the `http-server` and uses the current `http` server in `gzbridge` to serve the application.

Running instructions: 
    1- `npm run start` this command is still the same, with the `port` as option
    2- Navigate to `localhost:8080/index.html`
update.title: Use a single server
